title: New Tail for China’s ‘Wolf Warrior’ Diplomats
description: How is Chinese president Xi Jinping using the Tao-te Ching to shape China's national strategy?

title: Violent Domestic Extremist Groups and the Recruitment of Veterans
description: Seth G. Jones, senior vice president, Harold Brown Chair, and director of the International Security Program, testified before the House Veterans’ Affairs Committee on " Violent Domestic Extremist Groups and the Recruitment of Veterans.”

title: The Evening: Moderna Half-Dose Booster, U.S. Embassy in Colombia Havana Syndrome, Ronnie Wood, and More
description: This edition of CSIS's nightly newsletter covers the Moderna Half-Dose Booster, U.S. Embassy in Colombia Havana Syndrome, Ronnie Wood, and More.

title: UPDATE: China Continues to Transform Ream Naval Base
description: Over the course of August and September, three new buildings have gone up and a new road has been cleared at Cambodia's Ream Naval Base, where concerns over possible Chinese military access linger amid Beijing-backed construction.

title: The Joint Expeditionary Force: Toward a Stronger and More Capable European Defense?
description: Northern Europe’s Joint Expeditionary Force (JEF) just wrapped up a big exercise in Sweden. What is the JEF, what does it mean for transatlantic security and what role can the United States play in support?

title: The Role of the Oil Sector in Venezuela’s Environmental Degradation and Economic Rebuilding
description: Senior Fellow Ryan Berg discusses the decline of Venezuela's once-powerful oil sector, the environmental impacts of the oil sector in Venezuela, the role of oil in any political transition, and provides policy recommendations to address these issues.

title: We Have a China Trade Policy—or Do We?
description: The Scholl Chair recaps USTR Katherine Tai's remarks at CSIS last week. Does the United States have a China trade policy? And if so, how will our plans be implemented?

title: Global Efforts Required to Cut Methane Emissions
description: There are no quick wins in the fight against climate change, but methane abatement comes close. ESG pressure, new technologies, and regulation are driving change, but any strategy on methane should engage Asian gas buyers.

title: U.S. Military Forces in FY 2022: Peering into the Abyss—The Budget and Strategy Overview
description: CSIS produces a series of papers on US military forces, including their composition, new initiatives, long-term trends, and challenges. In FY 2022, military forces are “peering into the abyss,” as constrained budgets and strategy changes push the services to cut forces.

title: Book Event: Lawrence O. Gostin’s “Global Health Security: A Blueprint for the Future”
description: Please join J. Stephen Morrison and H. Andrew Schwartz for a discussion of Lawrence O. Gostin's latest book, "Global Health Security: A Blueprint for the Future."

title: An Urban Test Case: Learning from Cabo Verde
description: The West African archipelago of Cabo Verde provides a glimpse into Africa’s urban future. Judd Devermont and Marielle Harris outline challenges around coordination, planning, and a weak urban economy, with potential implications for cities across the region.

title: The Evening: Pfizer for Kids 5-11, CIA Mission Center on China, Madman Across the Water, and More
description: This edition of CSIS's nightly newsletter covers Pfizer for Kids 5-11, CIA Mission Center on China, Madman Across the Water, and More.
